intro: Canthium mundianum var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy canthium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its specific epithet "pubescens." The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecology.
